abstract: Critics say Google’s settlement with authors and publishers unfairly gives Google an exclusive license to profit from millions of books.
snippet: Critics say Google’s settlement with authors and publishers unfairly gives Google an exclusive license to profit from millions of books.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  The Justice Department has begun an inquiry into the antitrust implications of Google’s settlement with authors and publishers over its Google Book Search service, two people briefed on the matter said Tuesday.

headline.main: Justice Dept. Opens Antitrust Inquiry Into Google Books Deal
headline.print_headline: U.S. Opens Inquiry Into Google Books Deal
